item.title: RT by @brian_bilston: #KirkleesWelcomes #RefugeeWeek2022 #CarryMyStory http://www.springgrovejin.co.uk one of over 30 schools from across Kirklees taking part in this week's finale. Love this poetry from the amazing children, a take on the amazing work of @brian_bilston

item.title: RT by @brian_bilston: We’re giving away six original Virago Modern Classics. Follow and RT by midnight on Friday 1st July: the winner or winners will be informed next week. And you can listen to our episode on Rosamond Lehmann with guest @elizabday here. https://www.backlisted.fm/episodes/38-the-weather-in-the-streets-rosamond-lehmann
item.dc:creator: @BacklistedPod

item.title:
And then next Sunday at @LedburyPoetry I shall be attempting to break T.S. Eliot’s world record for the most keepie-uppies while reciting a poem, as I read from my collection ‘50 Ways to Score a Goal’.
That event is free but you’ll need to get a ticket.
https://www.poetry-festival.co.uk/events/22-18/
item.dc:creator: @brian_bilston
item.description:

That event is free but you’ll need to get a ticket.

poetry-festival.co.uk/events…

item.title:
And next weekend, I’ll be at @LedburyPoetry. On Saturday, I’ll be reading poems from ‘Alexa, what is there to know about love?’, ‘Diary of a Somebody’, ‘You Took the Last Bus Home’ and the forthcoming ‘Days Like These’.
https://www.poetry-festival.co.uk/events/22-16/
item.dc:creator: @brian_bilston
item.description:

poetry-festival.co.uk/events…

item.title:
I’ll be out and about reading poems at a few events over the next week or so.
Do get yourself a ticket if you’re nearby and fancy it.
On Wednesday, I’ll be with @kibworthbooks in Kibworth, Leicestershire.
https://kibworthbooks.com/products/an-evening-with-brian-bilston
item.dc:creator: @brian_bilston

item.title: R to @brian_bilston: Anyhow, I don’t really want to have this debate. I try to use Twitter as positively as I can, including the interactions I have with others. Hope you understand and thanks.
item.dc:creator: @brian_bilston
item.description: Anyhow, I don’t really want to have this debate. I try to use Twitter as positively as I can, including the interactions I have with others. Hope you understand and thanks.

item.title: R to @Bacchunalian: I have no problem with you holding a different view to mine. And if I searched on Twitter I’d find 100s of people who agree with you. I just find it problematic when people go out of their way to criticise something I’ve so obviously enjoyed. I don’t understand the motivation.
item.dc:creator: @brian_bilston
item.description: I have no problem with you holding a different view to mine. And if I searched on Twitter I’d find 100s of people who agree with you. I just find it problematic when people go out of their way to criticise something I’ve so obviously enjoyed. I don’t understand the motivation.

item.title: R to @Nellfr16: One of the most tiresome aspects of Twitter is when you tweet your enthusiasm about something you’ve enjoyed only to get responses informing you that you are wrong.
item.dc:creator: @brian_bilston
item.description: One of the most tiresome aspects of Twitter is when you tweet your enthusiasm about something you’ve enjoyed only to get responses informing you that you are wrong.
